metadata.title: CVE-2018-20671 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
load_specific_debug_section in objdump.c in GNU Binutils through 2.31.1contains an integer overflow vulnerability that can trigger a heap-basedbuffer overflow via a crafted section size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm5').
